actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.R. 4366 (Rep. Carter):
        A bill making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes.

        -- Considered by Senate.
 

 S.Amdt. 1092 (Sen. Murray):
        In the nature of a substitute.

        --Considered by Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1205 (Sen. Murray):
        To change the effective date.

        --Considered by Senate.


 S.Amdt. 1230 (Sen. Schumer):
        To change the effective date.

        --Considered by Senate.




 S.Res. 238 (Sen. Tester):
        A resolution expressing support for recognizing September 20 as National Service Dog Day.

        -- Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.
 

 S.Amdt. 1261 (Sen. Tester):
        To amend the preamble.

        --Amendment SA 1261 proposed by Senator Reed for Senator Tester.

        --Amendment SA 1261 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.




 S.Res. 351 (Sen. King):
        A resolution designating September 25, 2023, as "National Lobster Day".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 352 (Sen. Manchin):
        A resolution designating September 2023 as "National Childhood Cancer Awareness Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN173:
        Rita F. Lin, of California, to be United States District Judge for the Northern District of California

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 231 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 52 - 45. Record Vote Number: 232 



 PN591:
        Vernon D. Oliver, of Connecticut, to be United States District Judge for the District of Connecticut

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 44. Record Vote Number: 230
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Reed, at  7:52 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
